intro: Capnites, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has a low-growing habit, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Capnites is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
